comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content:
Foley's bridge was built in 1787 by James Hamilton, 2nd Earl of Clanbrassil, in honour of his wife Grace Foley www.dardni.gov.uk/tollymore_forest_park_change_over_time.pdf (PDF) From Page 22 of the document above:
Ladies from Tollymore House pose by Foley's Bridge. Here they would read, paint in water colours and write poems and letters. James Hamilton, the Second Earl of Clanbrassil built Foley’s Bridge in 1787 in honour of his wife Grace Foley. The Earl liked to drive about his estate in his horse and carriage. Therefore nice drives were created so that the Earl could show off his estate to anybody visiting him or the family.
